sub_title: Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café
summary: Experienced freelance curator and Japanese art consultant with a demonstrated history of working in the fine art industry. Skilled in Art History, Curating, Social Media, Fine Art, and Museum Collections. Strong arts and design professional with an affinity for 20th century Japanese prints and media.

treasury_media.description: Located in Amsterdam, Nihon no hanga is a private museum dedicated to showcase exhibitions created around a collection of 20th century Japanese prints. We are open to the public in May and November.

contributors.headline: Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café

projects.title: Exhibition: 'From ukiyo-e to hanga' at Camera Japan Festival
projects.description: For a long time, Japanese woodblock prints have intrigued audiences all over the world. Since the 17th century ukiyo-e (lit. images of the floating world) served traditional imagery of Japan. But woodblock printing evolved and by the 20th century, it became known as hanga (lit. printing block/plate picture) because it contained modernistic expressions of contemporary culture. In a chronological overview, this exhibition provides an introduction to the most iconic artists and genres known to this captivating art form.

contributors.headline: Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café

projects.title: Curator: 'Sōsaku hanga: Creative Prints from Japan | Sōsaku hanga: Creatieve prentkunst uit Japan' at Japanmuseum SieboldHuis
projects.description:
From 17 December 2021 to 13 March 2022 (extended until 29 May 2022) over 140 works of the sōsaku hanga movement will be on display at Japan Museum SieboldHuis in Leiden showcasing the creative autonomy of the Japanese print artists. ‘Sōsaku hanga’ is a must see exhibition for lovers of traditional Japanese prints and connoisseurs of modern art.

Van 17 december 2021 t/m 13 maart 2022 (wegens sluiting verlengd t/m 29 mei 2022) toont Japanmuseum SieboldHuis ‘Sōsaku hanga. Creatieve prentkunst uit Japan’. Zo'n tweehonderd werken van de sōsaku hanga-beweging tonen de ontwikkeling van de ‘creatieve prentkunst’ in Japan. Voor het eerst in Europa wordt er een tentoonstelling gewijd aan deze stroming waarbij de creatieve autonomie van de Japanse prentkunstenaars centraal staat. ‘Sōsaku hanga’ is een must voor zowel liefhebbers van traditionele prenten, als voor kenners van moderne kunst.

contributors.headline: Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café

projects.title: Registrar: 'One Hundred Aspects of the Moon: Japanese Woodblock Prints by Tsukioka Yoshitoshi' at Museum of East Asian Art Cologne
projects.description:
From September 2020 the Museum of East Asian Art Cologne shows 100 Aspects of the Moon by Tsukioka Yoshitoshi (1839–1892). This exhibition is on view from 17 September 2021 until 9 January 2022.

Yoshitoshi was the last great woodblock print master of the Ukiyo-e tradition, and 100 Aspects of the Moon is regarded as his greatest achievement. The series brings to life the history and mythology of ancient Japan. In all 100 prints the moon figures prominently. Sometimes clearly visible in the design and sometimes referred to in the beautiful poems in the text cartouche.

Yoshitoshi's 100 Aspects of the Moon is very popular among collectors. However, it rarely happens that a complete set in an excellent condition is brought together. The Museum of East Asian Art Cologne will show you one of the finest known sets in the world, which is currently housed in the renowned collection of Japanese print Museum Nihon no Hanga in Amsterdam.

contributors.headline: Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café

projects.title: Curator: 'Neko. The Cat in Japanese Art | Neko. De kat in Japanse kunst' at Japanmuseum SieboldHuis
projects.description:
From 31 January 2020 until 5 July 2020 (later extended until 13 September 2020) the exhibition 'Neko. The Cat in Japanese Art' will be on view at Japanmuseum Sieboldhuis in Leiden, the Netherlands. With traditional and contemporary Japanese prints, rare drawings, objects, beautiful scroll paintings and contemporary photography, will show the role of the cat in Japanese art through the centuries.

Van 31 januari 2020 t/m 5 juli 2020 (vanwege sluiting verlengd tot 13 september 2020) toont Japanmuseum SieboldHuis te Leiden de tentoonstelling ‘Neko. De kat in Japanse kunst’. Met traditionele- en hedendaagse Japanse prenten, zeldzame tekeningen, objecten, fraaie rolschilderingen en hedendaagse foto’s wordt de rol van de kat in de Japanse kunst door de eeuwen heen getoond.

contributors.headline: Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café

projects.title: Yoshitoshi
projects.description: The Yoshitoshi project involved the creation of a traveling exhibition based on the Edmund Freis Collection of Japanese prints by the major Meiji artist Tsukioka Yoshitoshi (1839-1892). The prints were shown in the Sieboldhuis in Leiden, The Netherlands (9 December 2011 until 18 March 2013) and the Pacific Asia Museum in Pasadena, USA (18 May 2012 until 12 August 2012).

company.name: Nihon no hanga | Japanese Print Collection

profile_positions.company: Nihon no hanga | Japanese Print Collection
profile_positions.description: Building a collection of 20th century Japanese prints. Conceptualizing, researching, organizing, producing and installing two exhibitions per calendar year. Author of numerous publications. Cataloguing and overall care of the growing collection of 20th century Japanese prints, paintings and illustrated books. Hosting lectures and guided tours for every exhibition, PR through website, social media and newsletter. Developing digital platform with Art Research Center, Ritsumeikan University (Japan). Coordinated exhibition and publication projects with a.o. Clark Center (USA), Fondation Baur Musée des Arts d'Extrême-Orient (Geneva), Japan Museum SieboldHuis (Leiden), Fondation Custodia (Paris), Ashmolean Museum (Oxford), and Museum für Ostasiatische Kunst Köln.
profile_positions.title: Curator

profile_positions.company: Nihon no hanga | Japanese Print Collection
profile_positions.description:
The Nihon no hanga collection includes over 2000 Japanese prints of which 90% dates from the 20th century. Nihon no hanga has as its goal to provide a comprehensive overview of the developments in 20th century Japanese print production. Twice a year we produce an exhibition exploring a variety of themes, accompanied by an exhibition catalogue. Our largest publication featuring the two main movements of 20th century Japanese printmaking titled 'Waves of renewal: modern Japanese prints 1900 to 1960'​ was released February 2016.
The museum is open to the public in May and November every year.
profile_positions.title: Junior curator

profile_positions.description:
As a specialist of Japanese art, with a focus on Japanese woodblock prints, I am available for projects in the cultural field. I have over ten years of curatorial experience, including: researching, compiling and writing publications; developing and producing (international) exhibitions; creating and maintaining databases; collection building, management and preservation; organising cultural activities; hosting lectures and workshops. I also have extensive commercial experience and am available for Japanese art appraisals.

Bokashi means colour gradation and is found in Japanese woodblock prints. The technique is often applied to visually recreate the natural gradient of the changing colours of the sky. Bokashi is eye catching and a beautiful highlight of Japanese prints, found in traditional ukiyo-e as well as 20th century hanga.

Freelance projects: 
Collection registrar: Prints donated by Für Elise Foundation at Rijksmuseum Amsterdam (October 2022 - Present).
Curator: 'Sōsaku hanga. Creative Prints from Japan | Sōsaku hanga. Creatieve prentkunst uit Japan' at Japan Museum SieboldHuis (17 December 2021 - 29 May 2022).
Contributor: 'Moga: Contemporary Beauties in Modern Japanese Prints' in Tokyo: Art & Photography, pp 108-119. Oxford: Ashmolean Museum, 2021.
Curator: 'Neko. The Cat in Japanese Art | Neko. De kat in Japanse kunst' at Japan Museum SieboldHuis (31 January 2020 - 13 September 2020).
profile_positions.title: Freelance curator, writer, and consultant of Japanese art

profile_positions.description: Met Het Indo Café onderzoeken we de effecten van het koloniale verleden van Indo families op de hedendaagse Rotterdamse maatschappij.
profile_positions.title: Medeoprichter

profile_positions.description: Gallery specialized in 19th century Japanese prints. Participated in commercial art fairs, advised collectors. Conducted art research on traditional and modern Japanese prints, paintings, 20th century bronze objects, lacquer ware and contemporary ceramics. Coordinated exhibition and publication projects for museums such as Japan Museum SieboldHuis, USC Pacific Asia Museum (Pasadena), Royal Museums of Art and History (Brussels) and Van Gogh Museum.
profile_positions.title: Art gallery assistant / Japanese art researcher

profile_positions.description: Project: catalogued the collection of Japanese woodblock print acquired by Vincent van Gogh in preparation of the 'Van Gogh & Japan' exhibition (2018) and its accompanying publications 'Japanese prints. The collection of Vincent van Gogh' and 'Van Gogh & Japan'.
profile_positions.title: Collection registrar Japanese prints

profile_positions.description: Project: catalogued the collection of surimono. Project was extended to catalogue the collections of sensō-e and of Meiji and Taishō period illustrated books and woodblock prints.
profile_positions.title: Cataloguer surimono collection PK online

profile_positions.description: Project: organized and coordinated an international conference to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the Society for Japanese Arts, focusing on the greater Taishō period (1900-1940) Japanese arts and culture.
profile_positions.title: Taisho Conference Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Project: curated and organized the first museum exhibition on Hello Kitty in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Co-curator Hello Kitty Hello Holland exhibition

volunteer_experiences.description:
A Japanese cultural festival with its main focus on film that also dives into other areas like art, music, dance, fashion, architecture, food, a kid's programme and many more. The annual event takes place every autumn in several cities in The Netherlands.

Conceptualized and organized a local annual Japanese film festival. Produced workshops and activities for kids. Curated art exhibitions.

The Heinz M. Kaempfer Fund is associated with the Society for Japanese Arts and established in the Netherlands. The fund aims at promoting studies of Japanese arts and crafts and the publication of those studies, especially amongst younger scholars.

Supervised fund, coordinated and evaluated bursary applications. Organized annual lectures and symposia.

In 1937 'The Society for Japanese Arts and Crafts' which was later renamed 'Society for Japanese Arts' was founded by a small group of Dutch collectors and dealers. Meetings took place in the houses of its members who aimed at "bringing together collectors and those interested in Japanese art in general and graphic art more specifically in order to further the appreciation of these arts and their study".

Digitally reorganized the society's administration; membership management, organized lectures and workshops on Japanese art.
